channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Venezuela releases imprisoned opposition figures, which Trump says U.S. requested
item.description: Venezuela released a number of imprisoned high-profile opposition figures, activists and journalists, in what the government described as a gesture to "seek peace".
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela released a number of imprisoned high-profile opposition figures, activists and journalists, in what the government described as a gesture to "seek peace".

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Poll: Fewer Americans see U.S. as moral leader. And, FBI takes over ICE shooting case
item.description: Many Americans say the U.S. is not a moral leader but want it to be, according to an NPR/Ipsos poll. And, the FBI is taking over the investigation into the fatal Minnesota ICE shooting.
item.content:encoded:
Many Americans say the U.S. is not a moral leader but want it to be, according to an NPR/Ipsos poll. And, the FBI is taking over the investigation into the fatal Minnesota ICE shooting.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: We're going to the Olympics! What do you want to know?
item.description: Here's how to send your questions and curiosities to the NPR team covering the Winter Olympics in Milan.
item.content:encoded:
Here's how to send your questions and curiosities to the NPR team covering the Winter Olympics in Milan.

(Image credit: Mattia Ozbot)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Maduro is out, Congress is in and the quiz is back! Start 2026 with a perfect score
item.description: Plus: What's up with Wicked, Greenland, quarters and Jan. 6?
item.content:encoded: Plus: What's up with Wicked, Greenland, quarters and Jan. 6?
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Your next primary care doctor could be online only, accessed through an AI tool
item.description: The shortage of primary care doctors is a national problem. To cope, a large health system in Massachusetts is using an AI tool to screen patients and refer them to other care.
item.content:encoded:
The shortage of primary care doctors is a national problem. To cope, a large health system in Massachusetts is using an AI tool to screen patients and refer them to other care.

(Image credit: Jesse Costa)
item.dc:creator: Martha Bebinger

item.title: Many Americans say the U.S. is not a moral leader but want it to be: NPR/Ipsos poll
item.description: Commissioned by NPR in partnership with Ipsos, the poll also highlights sharp partisan divides on key foreign policy issues.
item.content:encoded:
Commissioned by NPR in partnership with Ipsos, the poll also highlights sharp partisan divides on key foreign policy issues.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Vincent Ni

item.title: The Golden Globes are this weekend. Hear from some of the nominees
item.description: The Golden Globe are Sunday night. Revisit some of the nominees that have appeared on NPR's "Morning Edition" this past year.
item.content:encoded: The Golden Globe are Sunday night. Revisit some of the nominees that have appeared on NPR's "Morning Edition" this past year.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: A look at how the cocaine trade works
item.description: The business of cocaine trafficking has changed over the years, with different players and routes. A look at how the trade really works.
item.content:encoded: The business of cocaine trafficking has changed over the years, with different players and routes. A look at how the trade really works.
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: ICE shootings are a 'direct byproduct' of tactic shift, ex-ICE acting director says
item.description: There have been several incidents of ICE agents fatally shooting or injuring people in U.S. cities. After a shooting in Portland on Thursday, city officials there called it a "pattern of violence."
item.content:encoded: There have been several incidents of ICE agents fatally shooting or injuring people in U.S. cities. After a shooting in Portland on Thursday, city officials there called it a "pattern of violence."
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: 2 friends share how the COVID pandemic put a strain on their relationship
item.description: Two friends with opposing viewpoints talk about the strain the COVID-19 pandemic put on their relationship and how they can move forward.
item.content:encoded: Two friends with opposing viewpoints talk about the strain the COVID-19 pandemic put on their relationship and how they can move forward.
item.dc:creator: Esther Honig
